meanings.definition: To make a bubbling or gurgling sound.
meanings.sent1: The stream gurgled softly as it flowed over the rocks.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the tea kettle gurgling on the stove.
meanings.sent3: The baby found it funny when the bathtub gurgled like a tiny waterfall.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter gurgled out of her like a bubbling brook.
meanings.sent5: The soda can gurgled when I opened it, releasing the fizz.

meanings.sent1: The gurglet of the brook was soothing to listen to.
meanings.sent2: The gurglet of the coffee machine signaled it was ready.
meanings.sent3: The gurglet of the fish tank made the room feel like an underwater world.
meanings.sent4: The gurglet of the stream was a symphony of nature's music.
meanings.sent5: The gurglet of the fountain added a peaceful ambiance to the garden.

meanings.definition: The act of making a bubbling or gurgling sound.
meanings.sent1: The gurglet of the water was a sign that the dishwasher was running.
meanings.sent2: She imitated the gurglet of the river by blowing bubbles in her drink.
meanings.sent3: The gurglet of the pot boiling over made her jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The gurglet of the creek was like a secret language of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The gurglet of the hot spring was a natural wonder to behold.
